turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Sikelgaita.
turn.1: What does tradition say about Sikelgaita?
turn.2: According to the Byzantine historian Anna Comnena, she was "like another Pallas, if not a second Athena," and, in the "Alexiad", Anna attributes to her a quote from the "Iliad".
turn.3: What role did she play in Italian politics?
turn.4: In 1083, Sikelgaita returned to Italy with Robert to defend Pope Gregory VII against the Emperor Henry IV.
turn.6: She accompanied him on a second campaign against the Byzantines, during which Robert died on Kefalonia in 1085 with Sikelgaita at his side.
turn.7: What else did you find interesting about her?
turn.8: Early in 1086, Sikelgaita was in Salerno making a donation of the town of Centraro in his honour to Montecassino, which the couple had endowed well throughout their married life.
turn.9: Were there other things she did in politics?
turn.10: Sikelgaita donated a large amount of silver for her health while she was ill on another occasion.
turn.11: Did she receive any recognition or awards?
turn.12: Supposedly, she tried to poison Robert's son Bohemond by his first wife, although the two eventually came to an agreement by which her son Roger Borsa was allowed to succeed Robert in the duchy.
